column4: The idea is to move the files.. and if the folders already exist just.. add them to the current folders
Doesnt work
slyboots@Beluga:/media/array/Videos/TV/Deadliest Warrior1$ sudo mv -f * ../Deadliest\ Warrior
mv: cannot move `Season 1' to `../Deadliest Warrior/Season 1': Directory not empty
Because the folder "Season 1" already exists in the target directory, apparnetly thats some huge crime and mv wont play ball
Running the move as root
(hense Sudo)
So.. no-one any clue why I cant do the most *basic* file managment?
I mean I dont mean to be rude but.. I dont understand how this doesnt come up all the time
No clobber eh?
rsync should handle it
But thats copying..
It has options to remove source files files and such
Plus I dont think rsync will delete folders.. only files
You are moving directories, that's different from regular files.
You mean coreutils handles badly, linux is not the issue
rsync + rmdir
Adn if rsync fails or some reason it deletes my files :P
No.
rsync only deletes upon successful copy, and rmdir only deletes empty directories.
It's likely in a separate file under /etc/apt/sources.list.d/
